Reviews.Title: Overall pleased with product... but there are a few things here and there...
Reviews.Author: Pretty Happy
Reviews.Content: I bought this product on Black Friday at Best Buy for $499.99. I am glad that I didn't pay the price listed. Overall the computer is great, but there are a few things that bother me. It's a Windows 8 computer, and sometimes when I drag my finger across the touch pad, it sends me back to the previous app that I had open off of the main screen. I can easily get back to what I was doing but it shouldn't happen to begin with. Physically, the black surrounding the screen pops when I move it (like when I am adjusting the screen forward and backwards, I don't just randomly squeeze my computer).The computer is very fast and it's taken a little bit to get used to since I am going from a Windows 7 to a Windows 8. I haven't figured out how to put Microsoft on the desktop (or any icon on to the desktop) but I am sure I will figure that out sooner or later. The sound on this is great (especially compared to my old Acer computer) and I find myself only having it halfway and it's still a little loud for my taste! I didn't have any trouble setting up wireless or Microsoft Defender (the Windows 8 version of Microsoft Essentials) but Norton did get in the way from setting it up at first. There are a lot of available apps that you can put on the front screen, a lot of them being free!!I found it strange that all of the function keys are opposite from what I am used to; for example: before I would press F5 and the page would refresh, but now I have to press FN F5 for it to refresh and the other function (the backlit keyboard on and off) is the first function. I hope that makes sense!The keyboard is easy to type on, and the letters aren't having any problem with sticking. They are soft in a way and it's very comfortable.I set up my computer so that when I unlock it, I have to swipe my finger on the scanner and I haven't had any problems with that either. It's kind of fun having such a personal computer!I would suggest this product for someone else.

Reviews.Title: Got it. Love it.
Reviews.Author: G. K. Youngblood
Reviews.Content: Cons:I have owned many HP laptops in my day. It just ends up happening. I do not like that they put in a bunch of HP software that I never use and perpetually gets in my way. Also, the first unit I purchased had some weird glitch where every 65 second the DVD drive would pop open. However, now that I have a working one I like it so much I felt the need to review it. Also, this computer is trying really hard to be an Apple product. It's silver shell and black back lit keyboard echo that of a Macbook. However, it is light and feels like a cheaper version of the apple product. Finally, there is a movement to change the design of the arrow keys so that left and right buttons are full sized but up and down buttons are half sized. I use these buttons all the time and the half sized buttons are annoying.So enough of the negatives. What are the things that make this a four star product?1. It is a cheaper product. It costs over 50% less than an apple product. I love the price. And I think for what is paid the laptop offers a lot.2. Backlit keyboard. It is a perk I have been waiting for. they seems to usually be reserved for ultrabooks. It is nice to see the price point drop on this feature.3. I am not much of a computer "guts" kind of guy. I just want the computer to do what I want it to. I do not need to know all the inside stuff. I do know that the audio quality is good and I am able to run my PC games well on it without issue. I have heard reviews saying the screen is cheap but I have no complaints. It is higher quality than the laptop it replaced and for that i am grateful. I do not think the average user will feel cheated when it comes to the display quality.Overall, I just like it. It works well and I feel comfortable using it.

Reviews.Title: excelent
Reviews.Author: Fernando
Reviews.Content: this is a very good laptop a very light, amazing design and good quality, always bought HP because i think it's a good product

Reviews.Title: A solid performer - 4.5 stars
Reviews.Author: J. Chambers
Reviews.Content: I bought this laptop on sale at Best Buy about six months ago. My old desktop PC was dying, and I decided to go with a single computer for both home use and travel. The HP Envy M6 had the specs I wanted, and even though I didn't want Windows 8, I'm learning to use it. So far, it's been a great computer, except for one serious problem - the screen failed after only a few weeks. Since the laptop was still under warranty, I took it to Best Buy, and they returned it to HP. The repairs were made, and the laptop was returned to me eight days later, which is pretty good service.I like most of the features of the laptop, but the one that stands out most is the backlit keyboard. My eyesight isn't the best, but the backlighting makes the keys very visible, so much so that I don't know how I ever got along without this feature. The USB 3.0 ports are great, and I've replaced some of my older USB 2.0 devices to take advantage of the greater speed of USB 3.0. My wife has an older HP laptop that lacks the backlit keys and USB 3.0, so I know how handy both of those features are.I'm running MS Office 2007, Google Chrome, and other miscellaneous software with no problems. The laptop boots very quickly, and I have to thank HP for not loading it up with crapware like some manufacturers do. The Beats Audio has good sound for a laptop, but I usually use earbuds when I'm listening to music. Weighing just over five pounds, the laptop isn't much of a burden for traveling, and the case seems sturdy enough.Overall, I'm very pleased with the HP Envy M6 laptop. It has the computing power and speed of many desktops, and I'm enjoying using it as my primary computer.

Reviews.Title: Perfect Choice
Reviews.Author: Hanjad
Reviews.Content: If you need lots of Memory and a large hard drive together with a fast processor buy this. The silver color makes it attractive. the screen is delicate on your eyes and reduces fatigue. No one can go wrong with a HP.

Reviews.Title: love it
Reviews.Author: leah
Reviews.Content: I just got this computer and so far I love it. Not to up to date with the newest laptops and programs so I have to say this has been very easy for me to work with and learn as I go. its amazing what this laptop can do. so far so good. I have a great feeling about this investment. Anyways thanks for listening. : )

Reviews.Title: Worked!
Reviews.Author: Rosa Pulido
Reviews.Content: it wasn't to hard to install and works like a charm even after a couple of weeks of using the screen ive had no issues.

Reviews.Title: a slick sleek book
Reviews.Author: Gavin Gordon
Reviews.Content: fast, reliable, hp, intel, no problems, and it looks pretty too .for under 500 bucks can't beat it..only weakness; audio weak, sounds tinny one would think with todays technology they could improve in that area

Reviews.Title: keyboard is horrible
Reviews.Author: irishbreed
Reviews.Content: I called HP about the Keyboard and the number of times that the keys would not type in the letter stroked. The internet connection keeps dropping as well. The service person said that it was my fault for not testing the keyboard before buying it... REALLY, that is your response!!! How about I tell everyone what you said and not buy another product from your company. I was loyal to HP before that service person dissed me. Thank you HP for showing me that you do not care about a loyal consumer of your products.

Reviews.Title: Love it so much, I bought two
Reviews.Author: S. H. Schwartz "Technosopher"
Reviews.Content: These two laptops replace two MicroExpress desktop towers that I've had for nearly a decade.  The chiclet keyboard takes a bit of getting used to, but the touchpad has just the right responsiveness.  The backlit keyboard is a nice touch.  The numeric keyboard at the side is an absolute necessity for multinational characters.  Seems like many of the manufacturer are abandoning side and overlay keyboards.The fingerprint reader is superb for quickly unlocking the laptop.  I virtually always lock my account when stepping away; the fingerprint reader speeds up my return.The material is significantly cheaper.  In particular, the silver finish on the cover is an ultrathin veneer that rubs off from casual contact with a dresser drawer.  Also, the keyboard frame was not fully locked in on one of the laptops when first opened; I had to click it into place.  But these are cosmetic features for me.  The operational features are strong enough to warrant five stars.I also looked at Apple first.  They want $1500-1600 for a comparable machine.  I paid $700 for the HP at BestBuy.  I am buying several laptops, and Apple has priced itself out of my budget.

Reviews.Title: It's good, but has some bugs.
Reviews.Author: ecztasy
Reviews.Content: Well I've had this laptop for almost a year now so I decided to review it.Pros:Good size, looks nice, I also really like the backlight keyboard. I love being able to just have all the lights off and still be able to see everything perfectly. I also like that there's a whole number keypad. Laptop is fast and don't have problems with loading things or what not. Plenty of ram and memory. Total overkill really i mean 8gb of ram? I would have rather had less gb of storage and have solid state drive, but I wanted a lot of specific things and the laptops with ssd's are mostly ultrabooks and very expensive. It was decent price, I bought it from best buy for 700. Has good sound tooCons: The fingerprint scanner stoppedd working. It can be quite useful, use it for logging into any website and logging into your computer. Fan stopped working also... but just for a short time like a few days, not sure why but thought i was going to have to return it. The camera is mediocre. Also has bad intigrated graphics. But that is normal for intel  In hindsight I should have gotten the amd version of this computer, amd has better graphic support and it was actually 100 bucks cheaper. Anyways that's all I can think of right now. Battery life at the beginning was really good it's okay now. Probably get like

Reviews.Title: Fragile and frustrating
Reviews.Author: Kristopher R. Estep
Reviews.Content: Bought my first HP Envy with Windows 7 in November 2012, which lasted a month before bogging down when I was typing an email.  It kept getting hung up on the letters I was typing until finally locking up completely.  After hard restarting, could not get past the initial load screen.Took it back to where I bought it and exchanged for the same model with Windows 8.  Got it home and started it up, and was immediately greeted by a frozen pixel in the middle of the screen.Exchanged it the next day, then used the latest laptop only a couple times a week for the next 8-9 months before coming home one day and starting it up to find the screen was completely grey, turning to blue vertical lines once the start-up sequence was finished.  HP was quick to respond, but said I wasn't covered by warranty for hardware.  When I asked to be put through to someone with whom I could discuss options for getting the issue fixed, I was put on hold for ten minutes before I finally gave up on getting any real help.While it was working, I enjoyed most of the features such as the beats audio, the back-lit keyboard, and the finger scanner until it stopped working about a month before the screen did.  I did not care for the finger swiping on the mouse pad to change between active programs in Windows 8 (usually by accident) or the overall flimsiness of the computer (undoubtedly leading to the malfunctioning screen).

Reviews.Title: Better all the time
Reviews.Author: jcwartick
Reviews.Content: It is fast, beautiful and works fine for me. I like the finger print sign in, The backlit key board, the brilliant screen and the sound. I think all computers should come out with backlit keyboards.Thank you for being there HP.Jerry W.

Reviews.Title: great computer
Reviews.Author: Ammon M. Thompson
Reviews.Content: I'm very happy with this laptop. Have had very few problems (the occasional inexplicable BSOD error in very particular circumstances). Great value for the price.

Reviews.Title: Very Nice Laptop!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I just purchased one of these from another vendor, not Amazon. I got a heck of a deal, getting it brand new for under $400. It arrived in a distressed box, which I was aware of at the time of the purchase. I did purchase a 1TB SSD drive and 16GB of ram from Amazon for it. Would I buy this lapop again? Absolutely! This thing screams now and it was pretty fast prior to the upgrades. I have a HP Envy I bought last year, which I like, but when my son came home from college with a different HP and I saw his back lighted keyboard, I knew my other laptop was going to be replaced. I love the back lighted keyboard. The screen is nice and sharp. the DVD drive is quiet and fast. I haven't checked the battery to see how long it lasts under normal usage, especially with the updated SSD drive, but I do know that the battery lasted through 2 Nexflix movies with about 45% of the charge remaining, with the screen on full brightness. With the SSD drive, the fan stays quiet and the bottom on the laptop gets a little warm on the left side, but never hot or uncomfortable when on my lap. I like that the battery is user-replaceable, unlike my other Envy. I just discovered that mine doesn't have a bluetooth radio, so I am buying a bluetooth 4.0 usb adapter and I'll be set for a few years. I do some light to moderate gaming, movie watching, music playing, and movie burning, and this laptop handles it all very well. If you are considering this laptop, in my opinion, it is a worthwhile purchase.

Reviews.Title: Very happy with our new HP Envy 15.6" laptop
Reviews.Author: Patrick Helt
Reviews.Content: We're very pleased with this purchase as the laptop executes commands very quickly, the screen size is very nice, etc.  It came with Windows 8, which takes a bit of getting used to if you are used to early versions of Windows, but once you figure out how to navigate and execute commands, it gets much easier.

Reviews.Title: Perfect!!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Love it!! The only thing I would change is if it was a touch screen, which is something I was not even thinking about when I looked at the laptop.  It's fast, sleek, light weight. It's just perfect!

Reviews.Title: Very Happy!
Reviews.Author: Dellyn
Reviews.Content: I purchased this computer as a gift after first buying an Asus.  After problems with the Asus, this was the first choice for the recipient and they have nothing but praise for this computer. Based on their assessment, I would highly recommend it.  Ordering, shipping and packaging  were definitely a thumbs up as well.

Reviews.Title: Love my new computer
Reviews.Author: Ms KAM
Reviews.Content: I got this for Xmas and I love it. It has replaced my iPad and I use it exclusively now.

Reviews.Title: Love It
Reviews.Author: MrComputer
Reviews.Content: I love this product by HP. The price is just right and I love Windows 8. Without a doubt this is a laptop that everyone should have. It is also really light for traveling.

Reviews.Title: Not super. Dissapointed
Reviews.Author: Don Young
Reviews.Content: Was really a good Value. Love the lighted key board. Beats Audio is NO big dedal. Actually no volume. I thought it had a TOUCH Screen ?? NO. ! and No blue ray player.. Little  soft ware...  Don

Reviews.Title: Super fast, sleek, wonderful!
Reviews.Author: J.Gless
Reviews.Content: Finally!! I have tried two other models of HP laptops before this one! The first was the 17.3" Pavilion g7-2235dx, which was too slow and just bulky. Next, I tried the m6-1105dx, which is the same version as this one but with the AMD processor. The 1105dx was great except for the update issues.This one, fantastic! Great look and feel! Sleek silver color and light-weight! Very portable!The Intel i-5 processor is great! computer is super fast and I have had NO wireless. Backlit keyboard is a great feature and the finger-print scanner to sign in is a fun little extra (I love that I can use it for all my passwords too! The 8GB RAM is wonderful, again - super fast! Very happy that I was able to snatch this up for $500 as a Black Friday deal! Totally worth $500 and I would have paid the $700 for it.Beats audio sounds great too! Very happy with this purchase. Highly recommend this laptop to anyone looking. I just love this computer.

Reviews.Title: HP staff one question?
Reviews.Author: Chuck Kuhn
Reviews.Content: I've been using this amazing computer for 30 days. I bought two of them. One I upgraded to 16gb.  I've read other post from Best Buy, that complaint about computer having problems connecting at times to websites,emails etc etc.  I have the same problem. I have another HP icord 5 8gb and connects without stalling. Is there a fix for this? Please address where what you may think is wrong.  Otherwise I will have to return both of them. It's not my internet provider or connection, since I have 2 other HP laptops that are fantastic.  ThanksUpdate Jan 12, 2013, Still have the computers and the 16gb is blazing fast. Run ps6, lightroom 4 and thousand of photos to download with 3.0 just fast fast fast. Ok my first complaint about the internet connection. It was my search engine Google. For some reason Google wouldn't cooperate with this computer or my connection thru Comcast.  I use Explore, Mozella now and NO PROBLEMS.  I upgrade to Office 2010 for $99 for 3 machines and free 2013 upgrade.  Also note AutoDesk Cad doesn't work with Windows 8 as yet. I'm sold on Windows 8. Once you get the hang of the program, its fast. NO Need for touch screen you a mouse. Lighted keyboard a plus plus. Go for it

Reviews.Title: Screen cracks
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I have now gone through 2 of these computer within months.  The first one lasted less than 3 months, the second less than 6 months.  It definitely had a design flaw- if you touch the side black plastic frame around the screen...it flexes breaking the edge of the screen underneath-destroying it.  I wrote to HP on the design flaw and was satisfied with the response the first time---now waiting to see if they will stand behind the second one.  Not worth esp. considering all the time and effort to load your programs/data...  Get a different model.

Reviews.Title: Fast, good looking laptop
Reviews.Author: D. Slack
Reviews.Content: This is only my 2nd laptop because I prefer using computers on a desk, but I am very happy with my purchase.The light up keyboard is awesome and the screen is sharp and colors are beautiful.It is a fast system and I am only limited by my internet service when playing online games.Very happy.No negatives about the Envy, except I don't have Microsoft office and the windows 8 is hard to get used to.

Reviews.Title: Bad keyboard & mouse pad.
Reviews.Author: Nicholas Patterson
Reviews.Content: Very disappointed in this laptop. The keyboard is made out of the cheapest material I have ever seen on laptop. You would think the most used area would be built the toughest on this product. he bottom and sides of this computer are also made out of cheap plastic. I can't believe they are trying to pass this off a $690 laptop.

Reviews.Title: Awful laptop, stay away!
Reviews.Author: Gerardo
Reviews.Content: Ive never written a review before, but trust me, this is by far the worst laptop ive ever had. It has an annoying beep when battery comes below 10% that CANT be turned off and even dogs bark when this pice of crap starts beeping. Also, windows 8 is by far the worst OS ive ever had... It usually overheats while playing games.In the end, is a pice of crap, do not buy, stay away if you dont want to toss almos 1k down the drain. Also HP support service sucks, they cant disable this annoying beep? Its their product isnt it?Hate it...

Reviews.Title: Weak WLAN reception and lack of features make a deal-breaker for many.
Reviews.Author: Barthbill
Reviews.Content: This computer has one VERY serious fault and a number of inconveniences.1. The wireless reception is very weak. It is useful only in the strongest signal area. Even at Starbucks, I have to chose my table carefully, as it only works at some. It gets one bar and a lot of drops in a location where an older HP and a really old Lenovo had no trouble, and got several bars more. The 7 yr old Lenovo still gets 4 and 5 bars in the same spot. I would not recommend buying this unless you have very easy return privileges.2. It lacks a card slot, requiring an adapter for photo viewing. This is a serious inconvenience.3. The 4 USB ports are jammed together so that almost everything except the narrowest a USB device or connector interferes with the adjacent port. Things like aircards, antennas, card readers, connectors for an external mouse, etc. I have even had to use a knife to cut some rubber off of the side of some USB cord plugs. One USB port is so close to the power receptacle that some things interfere with the power cable plug. I had to use a knife to cut some rubber off the power plug to ease interference with USB devices. And, with this laptop's deficiencies, three of the four USB ports are taken up by necessary devices just to use the laptop. 1. The weak LAN reception requires a USB antenna to get a decent wi fi signal. 2. The poor touchpad requires an external mouse. 3. The lack of a card slot requires an external card reader. ...after the deficiencies of the laptop are taken care of by external devices, this leaves only one USB port left to use for thumb drives, printers, etc. As a result, one is always  juggling and balancing USB devices.4. The USB ports are loose and wiggly. They do not inspire confidence of a long life. My ancient Lenovo far surpasses this computer.5. The power cord receptacle on the right side is really inconvenient. Not only is it too close to one USB port, but it clutters up the area where many right-handers place a mouse or a beverage. A 90 degree cord end and a receptacle on the back would be much more versatile. Or maybe two receptacles  for those into cord management.6. The cord from the wall receptacle to the brick is incredibly bulky and stiff, having 3 heavy conductors. It is as heavy as a large microwave cord. Very inconvenient when stuffing it into my laptop bag or a briefcase. I see no reason for a ground, since the brick has no exposed metal parts.7. The lighted keyboard is neat, but only good for those who sit fairly close to the computer and are tall or sit high. A person who sits a little back or low gets the glare of the LEDs of the top rows of keys to mess up his night vision.8. The screen is very glossy, making reflections a problem.9. Easily damaged soft aluminum lid. I liked my 1 1/2 yr old HP's cross-hatched plastic body better than this one's aluminum lid. It will pick up scratches and marks and will look pristine only for a little while. the previous one's cross-hatched plastic seemed to hide everything.10. The keyboard is extraordinarily flimsy, with even the lightest touch making the area around each struck key flex downward. This does not inspire confidence.It's virtues are:1. Really good battery life and an accurate indicator of time left.2. The battery is user-replaceable, instead of being hijacked by sending it back to the center for a replacement. Also good for carrying a spare, or taking it out when plugged in to the wall.3. Light and thin. It means little to me, but it is important to some.4. The keyboard does not have a shrunken shift key like some recent laptops, although the delete key is really small. I would also be very happy to see the number pad on the right removed from small laptops.All in all, I think HP needs to be more careful which Chinese outsourced product they stick their decal on. The HP name means very little any more.5. The sound is a little better than most others.6. It still has an optical disk drive, making loading drivers and programs very convenient.7. The touch pad is a little better than the 1 1/2 yr old HP it replaced.8. The cord from brick to the laptop is longer than many other laptops

Reviews.Title: Horrible product
Reviews.Author: Stacie
Reviews.Content: I've had this computer about 5 weeks and I hate it. Here's why...- The finger swipe doesn't work half the time. It either locks on me or it takes me to the finger swipe homepage when it shouldn't do that.- I can't turn on finger swipe to register my print on websites anymore. Is there a limit to how many websites I can register????- When using the touchpad while surfing, it randomly closes my internet and takes me to desktop- Windows 8....let's not even get into how confusing that is- half the time my computer freezes on me so I have to shut it down or take the battery out to restart it- Not sure why folks like the sound system cause mine sounds averageI absolutely hate it

Reviews.Title: Low quality Screen
Reviews.Author: prosun
Reviews.Content: I do not like this laptop. Although the resolution is 1366 x 768, things on the screen does not look good. Other than the resolution, everything seems good. But, I gonna return it. Screen quality is important to me.
